text.name: sys_description
text.text: The PV-1000 is a console produced by Casio in Japan in 1983. It is powered by a Z80A processor clocked at 3.58 Mhz, has 2 kB of RAM and produces sound in three voices. It can display a resolution of 256x192 pixels with 8 simultaneous colors. Failing to achieve significant market share, the console would be pulled from the shelves after just a few weeks. Which is made one of the most fleeting and rare consoles in history. As a result, its toy library only has 15 games.
